#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Keep Academic Philosophy Alive

#Text=Academic philosophy such as the study of epistemology , ethics , logic , and metaphysics , have all but fallen by the wayside in the face of disciplines which seem to require much less analysis and contemplation and are geared towards jobs and money-making .
#Text=Is academic philosophy dead ?
#Text=How can you help to keep it alive , given that there are no jobs in the area ?
#Text=There is absolutely no need for a department of philosophy in the government or a private sector “ philosophy creation ” organization .
#Text=Or is there ?
#Text=Letting the basis of all thought and knowledge become obsolete or assume that everything has been said and done is not merely sad , it is dangerous .
#Text=The last time real new movement in the areas of logic and epistemology occurred was arguably with Wittgenstein .
#Text=That was over one hundred years ago .
#Text=Maybe it 's time for a new wave now .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Stop making fun of those who major in philosophy .
#Text=Encourage higher thinking children to continue to utilize their critical thinking skills in order to move all of us to a greater , and therefore better , place sociologically .
#Text=Support true academics in the area of philosophy who stand up to the vast Internet junk philosophy attempting to call itself true academic philosophy .
#Text=Basic ethics discussions are not necessarily academic philosophy .
#Text=Remember your first ethics class in college where you were required to state your conclusion , then support it with reasonably strong premises ?
#Text=For example , you might be asked to create a sound argument based on the premises you 've written in support of a woman 's right to choose .
#Text=Or , maybe you 've created an argument supporting the death penalty .

#Text=At any rate , these exercises are the most basic ways of introducing students and individuals not only to ethical thinking , but to the ways of creating sound and valid argument forms ; the basis of all philosophy .
#Text=It is not the intention to minimize the importance of ethics or ethics courses .
#Text=The problem is that if this is the last stand of academic philosophy , society is in big trouble .
#Text=Be familiar with logic , epistemology and avoid shallow ethics fight .
#Text=Avoid base level debates .

#Text=Encourage true academics to take a small amount of their time and educate participants on Internet sites of the basics of real philosophy , it might help to elevate the thinking and discussion of topics on these sites .
#Text=Set a goal and strive to become the next big thinker in the universe !
#Text=Why not ?
#Text=It is probably much more rare and certainly more difficult to become the next Stephen Hawking or Hume than it is to become the next Jay Z.
#Text=And it is absolutely the case that the money and fame will come much more slowly .
#Text=First there will be academic accolades , literary awards that might come with honorariums , but that 's not to say you wo n't be comfortable .

#Text=You 'll most certainly end up with a tidy sum of prize money and a secured professorship at an excellent university of your choice ! You 'll be able to travel the world lecturing on your theory and motivating others to do what you 've done ! Young and old , ' push yourselves as far as you can .
#Text=Do what you must to go about mastering this .
#Text=Write , think , and make a complete fool of yourself .
#Text=Read , get together in groups and challenge one another in every way possible .
#Text=Keep real thought alive , and keep academic philosophy alive !
#Text=Take a course that is far above your abilities .
#Text=If you have to fight to get in , do just that .
#Text=Join a study group with people whom you feel very comfortable with making a complete jerk of yourself .
#Text=If you do n't feel comfortable saying the most ridiculously wrong thing , you 'll never learn , and you 'll never advance .
#Text=Write , write , write .
#Text=Write all of the time .
#Text=Carry notebooks and fill them with every thought you have .
#Text=If you have a particularly important thought , develop a method of referring back to those " more important " thoughts , that way they do n't get lost amongst everything else .
